City Council District 5
-----------------------

![](https://ci.lubbock.tx.us/storage/images/URpKSZuJgHU5TX7j8Kuom5lm6H2SUZ69WAO7TWM6.jpg)

Dr. Jennifer Wilson, District 5
-------------------------------

Dr. Wilson is a lifelong Lubbock resident. After graduating from Texas Tech University with her Bachelor of Science degree in Biology, Dr. Wilson attended medical school at the American University of the Caribbean to pursue her passion of caring for children.
She is an Associate Professor in the Department of Pediatrics at the Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center School of Medicine, where she completed both her pediatric residency and pediatric hospital medicine fellowship after medical school. Dr. Wilson dedicates her professional life to training and mentoring medical students, residents and fellows at TTUHSC School of Medicine. She works as a Pediatric Hospital Medicine physician for UMC Children’s Hospital and Covenant Children’s Hospital.

She is board certified in Pediatrics and in Pediatric Hospital Medicine by the American Board of Pediatrics. She currently serves as the Vice Dean and the Pediatric Clerkship Director for the TTUHSC School of Medicine, Covenant branch campus. She also serves as the Medical Director for Camp New Beginnings summer camp for children with Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes.
Dr. Wilson currently serves on the School of Medicine Dean’s Executive Leadership Team, Faculty Council Executive Committee, TTUHSC School of Medicine Admissions Committee, Pediatric Hospital Medicine Fellowship Program Evaluation Committee, multiple medical education related committees, Covenant Health Continuing Medical Education Committee and the Providence Child/Adolescent Behavioral Health Collaborative.

In her community, Dr. Jennifer Wilson was elected to the Lubbock City Council as the representative for District 5 on May 7,

2022. District 5 is located in southwest Lubbock. As a City Council member, Dr. Wilson’s focus is community service and conservative principles. She believes citizens can, and should, expect effective and efficient essential city services. Her priorities include further strengthening public safety, encouraging growth and development, improving our city’s infrastructure, supporting small business and maintaining Lubbock’s small-town values.

She was appointed by the mayor to serve on the Transportation Policy committee for which she is currently the Vice Chairman as well as the West Texas Mental Health Collaborative.

Dr. Wilson’s husband, Nick, is the Assistant Fire Chief for Lubbock Fire Rescue, and they have two daughters, Alyssa and Adi. In her community, she participates in numerous charitable activities and is a devoted Red Raider fan. Dr. Wilson is a dedicated wife, mother, community leader, and is a proud resident of Lubbock.
.
